text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God;
speaker: Narrator

text: this one was in the beginning with God;
speaker: Narrator

text: all things through him did happen, and without him happened not even one thing that hath happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the light in the darkness did shine, and the darkness did not perceive it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came a man -- having been sent from God -- whose name [is] John,
speaker: Narrator

text: this one came for testimony, that he might testify about the Light, that all might believe through him;
speaker: Narrator

text: that one was not the Light, but -- that he might testify about the Light.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was the true Light, which doth enlighten every man, coming to the world;
speaker: Narrator

text: in the world he was, and the world through him was made, and the world did not know him:
speaker: Narrator

text: to his own things he came, and his own people did not receive him;
speaker: Narrator

text: but as many as did receive him to them he gave authority to become sons of God -- to those believing in his name,
speaker: Narrator

text: who -- not of blood nor of a will of flesh, nor of a will of man but -- of God were begotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Word became flesh, and did tabernacle among us, and we beheld his glory, glory as of an only begotten of a father, full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: John doth testify concerning him, and hath cried, saying, `This was he of whom I said, He who after me is coming, hath come before me, for he was before me;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of his fulness did we all receive, and grace over-against grace;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the law through Moses was given, the grace and the truth through Jesus Christ did come;
speaker: Narrator

text: God no one hath ever seen; the only begotten Son, who is on the bosom of the Father -- he did declare.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent out of Jerusalem priests and Levites, that they might question him, `Who art thou?'
speaker: Narrator

text: and he confessed and did not deny, and confessed -- `I am not the Christ.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And they questioned him, `What then? Elijah art thou?' and he saith, `I am not.' -- `The prophet art thou?' and he answered, `No.'
speaker: Narrator

text: They said then to him, `Who art thou, that we may give an answer to those sending us? what dost thou say concerning thyself?'
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, `I [am] a voice of one crying in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the Lord, as said Isaiah the prophet.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And those sent were of the Pharisees,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they questioned him and said to him, `Why, then, dost thou baptize, if thou art not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?'
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered them, saying, `I baptize with water, but in midst of you he hath stood whom ye have not known, this one it is who is coming after me, who hath been before me,
speaker: Narrator

text: of whom I am not worthy that I may loose the cord of his sandal.'
speaker: Narrator

text: These things came to pass in Bethabara, beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing,
speaker: Narrator

text: on the morrow John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, `Lo, the Lamb of God, who is taking away the sin of the world;
speaker: Narrator

text: this is he concerning whom I said, After me doth come a man, who hath come before me, because he was before me:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I knew him not, but, that he might be manifested to Israel, because of this I came with the water baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And John testified, saying -- `I have seen the Spirit coming down, as a dove, out of heaven, and it remained on him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I did not know him, but he who sent me to baptize with water, He said to me, On whomsoever thou mayst see the Spirit coming down, and remaining on him, this is he who is baptizing with the Holy Spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have seen, and have testified, that this is the Son of God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: On the morrow, again, John was standing, and two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having looked on Jesus walking, he saith, `Lo, the Lamb of God;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and the two disciples heard him speaking, and they followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus having turned, and having beheld them following, saith to them, `What seek ye?' and they said to them, `Rabbi, (which is, being interpreted, Teacher,) where remainest thou?'
speaker: Jesus

text: He saith to them, `Come and see;' they came, and saw where he doth remain, and with him they remained that day and the hour was about the tenth.
speaker: Jesus

text: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two who heard from John, and followed him;
speaker: Narrator

text: this one doth first find his own brother Simon, and saith to him, `We have found the Messiah,' (which is, being interpreted, The Anointed,)
speaker: Narrator

text: and he brought him unto Jesus: and having looked upon him, Jesus saith, `Thou art Simon, the son of Jonas, thou shalt be called Cephas,' (which is interpreted, A rock.)
speaker: Jesus

text: On the morrow, he willed to go forth to Galilee, and he findeth Philip, and saith to him, `Be following me.'
speaker: Jesus

text: And Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith to him, `Him of whom Moses wrote in the Law, and the prophets, we have found, Jesus the son of Joseph, who [is] from Nazareth;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nathanael said to him, `Out of Nazareth is any good thing able to be?' Philip said to him, `Come and see.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming unto him, and he saith concerning him, `Lo, truly an Israelite, in whom guile is not;'
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael saith to him, `Whence me dost thou know?' Jesus answered and said to him, `Before Philip's calling thee -- thou being under the fig-tree -- I saw thee.'
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael answered and saith to him, `Rabbi, thou art the Son of God, thou art the king of Israel.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, `Because I said to thee, I saw thee under the fig-tree, thou dost believe; greater things than these thou shalt see;'
speaker: Jesus

text: and he saith to him, `Verily, verily, I say to you, henceforth ye shall see the heaven opened, and the messengers of God going up and coming down upon the Son of Man.'
speaker: Jesus

text: And the third day a marriage happened in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there,
speaker: Narrator

text: and also Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage;
speaker: Narrator

text: and wine having failed, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, `Wine they have not;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `What -- to me and to thee, woman? not yet is mine hour come.'
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother saith to the ministrants, `Whatever he may say to you -- do.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were there six water-jugs of stone, placed according to the purifying of the Jews, holding each two or three measures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to them, `Fill the water-jugs with water;' and they filled them -- unto the brim;
speaker: Jesus

text: and he saith to them, `Draw out, now, and bear to the director of the apartment;' and they bare.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as the director of the apartment tasted the water become wine, and knew not whence it is, (but the ministrants knew, who have drawn the water,) the director of the feast doth call the bridegroom,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saith to him, `Every man, at first, the good wine doth set forth; and when they may have drunk freely, then the inferior; thou didst keep the good wine till now.'
speaker: Jesus

text: This beginning of the signs did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested his glory, and his disciples believed in him;
speaker: Narrator

text: after this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples; and there they remained not many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the passover of the Jews was nigh, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he found in the temple those selling oxen, and sheep, and doves, and the money-changers sitting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having made a whip of small cords, he put all forth out of the temple, also the sheep, and the oxen; and of the money-changers he poured out the coins, and the tables he overthrew,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to those selling the doves he said, `Take these things hence; make not the house of my Father a house of merchandise.'
speaker: Jesus

text: And his disciples remembered that it is written, `The zeal of Thy house did eat me up;'
speaker: Narrator

text: the Jews then answered and said to him, `What sign dost thou shew to us -- that thou dost these things?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, `Destroy this sanctuary, and in three days I will raise it up.'
speaker: Jesus

text: The Jews, therefore, said, `Forty and six years was this sanctuary building, and wilt thou in three days raise it up?'
speaker: Narrator

text: but he spake concerning the sanctuary of his body;
speaker: Narrator

text: when, then, he was raised out of the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this to them, and they believed the Writing, and the word that Jesus said.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as he was in Jerusalem, in the passover, in the feast, many believed in his name, beholding his signs that he was doing;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesus himself was not trusting himself to them, because of his knowing all [men],
speaker: Narrator

text: and because he had no need that any should testify concerning man, for he himself was knowing what was in man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a man of the Pharisees, Nicodemus his name, a ruler of the Jews,
speaker: Narrator

text: this one came unto him by night, and said to him, `Rabbi, we have known that from God thou hast come -- a teacher, for no one these signs is able to do that thou dost, if God may not be with him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, `Verily, verily, I say to thee, If any one may not be born from above, he is not able to see the reign of God;'
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus saith unto him, `How is a man able to be born, being old? is he able into the womb of his mother a second time to enter, and to be born?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, `Verily, verily, I say to thee, If any one may not be born of water, and the Spirit, he is not able to enter into the reign of God;
speaker: Jesus

text: that which hath been born of the flesh is flesh, and that which hath been born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Thou mayest not wonder that I said to thee, It behoveth you to be born from above;
speaker: Jesus

text: the Spirit where he willeth doth blow, and his voice thou dost hear, but thou hast not known whence he cometh, and whither he goeth; thus is every one who hath been born of the Spirit.'
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus answered and said to him, `How are these things able to happen?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to him, `Thou art the teacher of Israel -- and these things thou dost not know!
speaker: Jesus

text: `Verily, verily, I say to thee -- What we have known we speak, and what we have seen we testify, and our testimony ye do not receive;
speaker: Jesus

text: if the earthly things I said to you, and ye do not believe, how, if I shall say to you the heavenly things, will ye believe?
speaker: Jesus

text: and no one hath gone up to the heaven, except he who out of the heaven came down -- the Son of Man who is in the heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And as Moses did lift up the serpent in the wilderness, so it behoveth the Son of Man to be lifted up,
speaker: Jesus

text: that every one who is believing in him may not perish, but may have life age-during,
speaker: Jesus

text: for God did so love the world, that His Son -- the only begotten -- He gave, that every one who is believing in him may not perish, but may have life age-during.
speaker: Jesus

text: For God did not send His Son to the world that he may judge the world, but that the world may be saved through him;
speaker: Jesus

text: he who is believing in him is not judged, but he who is not believing hath been judged already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And this is the judgment, that the light hath come to the world, and men did love the darkness rather than the light, for their works were evil;
speaker: Jesus

text: for every one who is doing wicked things hateth the light, and doth not come unto the light, that his works may not be detected;
speaker: Jesus

text: but he who is doing the truth doth come to the light, that his works may be manifested, that in God they are having been wrought.'
speaker: Jesus

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples to the land of Judea, and there he did tarry with them, and was baptizing;
speaker: Narrator

text: and John was also baptizing in Aenon, nigh to Salem, because there were many waters there, and they were coming and were being baptized --
speaker: Narrator

text: for John was not yet cast into the prison --
speaker: Narrator

text: there arose then a question from the disciples of John with [some] Jews about purifying,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they came unto John, and said to him, `Rabbi, he who was with thee beyond the Jordan, to whom thou didst testify, lo, this one is baptizing, and all are coming unto him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered and said, `A man is not able to receive anything, if it may not have been given him from the heaven;
speaker: Jesus

text: ye yourselves do testify to me that I said, I am not the Christ, but, that I am having been sent before him;
speaker: Jesus

text: he who is having the bride is bridegroom, and the friend of the bridegroom, who is standing and hearing him, with joy doth rejoice because of the voice of the bridegroom; this, then, my joy hath been fulfilled.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Him it behoveth to increase, and me to become less;
speaker: Jesus

text: he who from above is coming is above all; he who is from the earth, from the earth he is, and from the earth he speaketh; he who from the heaven is coming is above all.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And what he hath seen and heard this he doth testify, and his testimony none receiveth;
speaker: Jesus

text: he who is receiving his testimony did seal that God is true;
speaker: Jesus

text: for he whom God sent, the sayings of God he speaketh; for not by measure doth God give the Spirit;
speaker: Jesus

text: the Father doth love the Son, and all things hath given into his hand;
speaker: Jesus

text: he who is believing in the Son, hath life age-during; and he who is not believing the Son, shall not see life, but the wrath of God doth remain upon him.'
speaker: Jesus

text: When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees heard that Jesus more disciples doth make and baptize than John,
speaker: Narrator

text: (though indeed Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disciples,)
speaker: Narrator

text: he left Judea and went away again to Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and it was behoving him to go through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cometh, therefore, to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the place that Jacob gave to Joseph his son;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there was there a well of Jacob. Jesus therefore having been weary from the journeying, was sitting thus on the well; it was as it were the sixth hour;
speaker: Narrator

text: there cometh a woman out of Samaria to draw water. Jesus saith to her, `Give me to drink;'
speaker: Narrator

text: for his disciples were gone away to the city, that they may buy victuals;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Samaritan woman therefore saith to him, `How dost thou, being a Jew, ask drink from me, being a Samaritan woman?' for Jews have no dealing with Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to her, `If thou hadst known the gift of God, and who it is who is saying to thee, Give me to drink, thou wouldest have asked him, and he would have given thee living water.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman saith to him, `Sir, thou hast not even a vessel to draw with, and the well is deep; whence, then, hast thou the living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who did give us the well, and himself out of it did drink, and his sons, and his cattle?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to her, `Every one who is drinking of this water shall thirst again;
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever may drink of the water that I will give him, may not thirst -- to the age; and the water that I will give him shall become in him a well of water, springing up to life age-during.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman saith unto him, `Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come hither to draw.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `Go, call thy husband, and come hither;'
speaker: Narrator

text: the woman answered and said, `I have not a husband.' Jesus saith to her, `Well didst thou say -- A husband I have not;
speaker: Narrator

text: for five husbands thou hast had, and, now, he whom thou hast is not thy husband; this hast thou said truly.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman saith to him, `Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet;
speaker: Narrator

text: our fathers in this mountain did worship, and ye -- ye say that in Jerusalem is the place where it behoveth to worship.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `Woman, believe me, that there doth come an hour, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father;
speaker: Narrator

text: ye worship what ye have not known; we worship what we have known, because the salvation is of the Jews;
speaker: Narrator

text: but, there cometh an hour, and it now is, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father also doth seek such to worship him;
speaker: Narrator

text: God [is] a Spirit, and those worshipping Him, in spirit and truth it doth behove to worship.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman saith to him, `I have known that Messiah doth come, who is called Christ, when that one may come, he will tell us all things;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `I am [he], who am speaking to thee.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon this came his disciples, and were wondering that with a woman he was speaking, no one, however, said, `What seekest thou?' or `Why speakest thou with her?'
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman then left her water-jug, and went away to the city, and saith to the men,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Come, see a man, who told me all things -- as many as I did; is this the Christ?'
speaker: Narrator

text: They went forth therefore out of the city, and were coming unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the meanwhile his disciples were asking him, saying, `Rabbi, eat;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said to them, `I have food to eat that ye have not known.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples then said one to another, `Did any one bring him anything to eat?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to them, `My food is, that I may do the will of Him who sent me, and may finish His work;
speaker: Narrator

text: do not say that it is yet four months, and the harvest cometh; lo, I say to you, Lift up your eyes, and see the fields, that they are white unto harvest already.
speaker: Narrator

text: `And he who is reaping doth receive a reward, and doth gather fruit to life age-during, that both he who is sowing and he who is reaping may rejoice together;
speaker: Narrator

text: for in this the saying is the true one, that one is the sower and another the reaper.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent you to reap that on which ye have not laboured; others laboured, and ye into their labour have entered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from that city many believed in him, of the Samaritans, because of the word of the woman testifying, -- `He told me all things -- as many as I did.'
speaker: Narrator

text: When, then, the Samaritans came unto him, they were asking him to remain with them, and he remained there two days;
speaker: Narrator

text: and many more did believe because of his word,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to the woman -- `No more because of thy speaking do we believe; for we ourselves have heard and known that this is truly the Saviour of the world -- the Christ.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the two days he went forth thence, and went away to Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Jesus himself testified that a prophet in his own country shall not have honour;
speaker: Narrator

text: when then, he came to Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all things that he did in Jerusalem in the feast -- for they also went to the feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came, therefore, again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine, and there was a certain courtier, whose son was ailing in Capernaum,
speaker: Narrator

text: he, having heard that Jesus is come out of Judea to Galilee, went away unto him, and was asking him that he may come down and may heal his son, for he was about to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then said unto him, `If signs and wonders ye may not see, ye will not believe.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The courtier saith unto him, `Sir, come down before my child die;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to him, `Be going on; thy son doth live.' And the man believed the word that Jesus said to him, and was going on,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he now going down, his servants met him, and told, saying -- `Thy child doth live;'
speaker: Narrator

text: he inquired then of them the hour in which he became better, and they said to him -- `Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him;'
speaker: Narrator

text: then the father knew that [it was] in that hour in which Jesus said to him -- `Thy son doth live,' and he himself believed, and his whole house;
speaker: Narrator

text: this again a second sign did Jesus, having come out of Judea to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: and there is in Jerusalem by the sheep-[gate] a pool that is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porches,
speaker: Narrator

text: in these were lying a great multitude of the ailing, blind, lame, withered, waiting for the moving of the water,
speaker: Narrator

text: for a messenger at a set time was going down in the pool, and was troubling the water, the first then having gone in after the troubling of the water, became whole of whatever sickness he was held.
speaker: Narrator

text: and there was a certain man there being in ailment thirty and eight years,
speaker: Narrator

text: him Jesus having seen lying, and having known that he is already a long time, he saith to him, `Dost thou wish to become whole?'
speaker: Narrator

text: The ailing man answered him, `Sir, I have no man, that, when the water may be troubled, he may put me into the pool, and while I am coming, another doth go down before me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to him, `Rise, take up thy couch, and be walking;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and immediately the man became whole, and he took up his couch, and was walking, and it was a sabbath on that day,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Jews then said to him that hath been healed, `It is a sabbath; it is not lawful to thee to take up the couch.'
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, `He who made me whole -- that one said to me, Take up thy couch, and be walking;'
speaker: Narrator

text: they questioned him, then, `Who is the man who is saying to thee, Take up thy couch and be walking?'
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that was healed had not known who he is, for Jesus did move away, a multitude being in the place.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things, Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said to him, `Lo, thou hast become whole; sin no more, lest something worse may happen to thee.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The man went away, and told the Jews that it is Jesus who made him whole,
speaker: Narrator

text: and because of this were the Jews persecuting Jesus, and seeking to kill him, because these things he was doing on a sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered them, `My Father till now doth work, and I work;'
speaker: Narrator

text: because of this, then, were the Jews seeking the more to kill him, because not only was he breaking the sabbath, but he also called God his own Father, making himself equal to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore responded and said to them, `Verily, verily, I say to you, The Son is not able to do anything of himself, if he may not see the Father doing anything; for whatever things He may do, these also the Son in like manner doth;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Father doth love the Son, and doth shew to him all things that He himself doth; and greater works than these He will shew him, that ye may wonder.
speaker: Narrator

text: `For, as the Father doth raise the dead, and doth make alive, so also the Son doth make alive whom he willeth;
speaker: Narrator

text: for neither doth the Father judge any one, but all the judgment He hath given to the Son,
speaker: Narrator

text: that all may honour the Son according as they honour the Father; he who is not honouring the Son, doth not honour the Father who sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Verily, verily, I say to you -- He who is hearing my word, and is believing Him who sent me, hath life age-during, and to judgment he doth not come, but hath passed out of the death to the life.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Verily, verily, I say to you -- There cometh an hour, and it now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and those having heard shall live;
speaker: Narrator

text: for, as the Father hath life in himself, so He gave also to the Son to have life in himself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and authority He gave him also to do judgment, because he is Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: `Wonder not at this, because there doth come an hour in which all those in the tombs shall hear his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall come forth; those who did the good things to a rising again of life, and those who practised the evil things to a rising again of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: `I am not able of myself to do anything; according as I hear I judge, and my judgment is righteous, because I seek not my own will, but the will of the Father who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: `If I testify concerning myself, my testimony is not true;
speaker: Narrator

text: another there is who is testifying concerning me, and I have known that the testimony that he doth testify concerning me is true;
speaker: Narrator

text: ye have sent unto John, and he hath testified to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: `But I do not receive testimony from man, but these things I say that ye may be saved;
speaker: Narrator

text: he was the burning and shining lamp, and ye did will to be glad, for an hour, in his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: `But I have the testimony greater than John's, for the works that the Father gave me, that I might finish them, the works themselves that I do, they testify concerning me, that the Father hath sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: `And the Father who sent me Himself hath testified concerning me; ye have neither heard His voice at any time, nor His appearance have ye seen;
speaker: Narrator

text: and His word ye have not remaining in you, because whom He sent, him ye do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: From this [time] was Pilate seeking to release him, and the Jews were crying out, saying, `If this one thou mayest release, thou art not a friend of Caesar; every one making himself a king, doth speak against Caesar.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate, therefore, having heard this word, brought Jesus without -- and he sat down upon the tribunal -- to a place called, `Pavement,' and in Hebrew, Gabbatha;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it was the preparation of the passover, and as it were the sixth hour, and he saith to the Jews, `Lo, your king!'
speaker: Narrator

text: and they cried out, `Take away, take away, crucify him;' Pilate saith to them, `Your king shall I crucify?' the chief priests answered, `We have no king except Caesar.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, therefore, he delivered him up to them, that he may be crucified, and they took Jesus and led [him] away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and bearing his cross, he went forth to the place called [Place] of a Skull, which is called in Hebrew Golgotha;
speaker: Narrator

text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on this side, and on that side, and Jesus in the midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate also wrote a title, and put [it] on the cross, and it was written, `Jesus the Nazarene, the king of the Jews;'
speaker: Narrator

text: this title, therefore, read many of the Jews, because the place was nigh to the city where Jesus was crucified, and it was having been written in Hebrew, in Greek, in Roman.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests of the Jews said, therefore, to Pilate, `Write not -- The king of the Jews, but that one said, I am king of the Jews;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, `What I have written, I have written.'
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers, therefore, when they did crucify Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to each soldier a part, also the coat, and the coat was seamless, from the top woven throughout,
speaker: Narrator

text: they said, therefore, to one another, `We may not rend it, but cast a lot for it, whose it shall be;' that the Writing might be fulfilled, that is saying, `They divided my garments to themselves, and upon my raiment they did cast a lot;' the soldiers, therefore, indeed, did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary of Cleopas, and Mary the Magdalene;
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, therefore, having seen [his] mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he was loving, he saith to his mother, `Woman, lo, thy son;'
speaker: Narrator

text: afterward he saith to the disciple, `Lo, thy mother;' and from that hour the disciple took her to his own [home].
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Jesus knowing that all things now have been finished, that the Writing may be fulfilled, saith, `I thirst;'
speaker: Narrator

text: a vessel, therefore, was placed full of vinegar, and they having filled a sponge with vinegar, and having put [it] around a hyssop stalk, did put [it] to his mouth;
speaker: Narrator

text: when, therefore, Jesus received the vinegar, he said, `It hath been finished;' and having bowed the head, gave up the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews, therefore, that the bodies might not remain on the cross on the sabbath, since it was the preparation, (for that sabbath day was a great one,) asked of Pilate that their legs may be broken, and they taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers, therefore, came, and of the first indeed they did break the legs, and of the other who was crucified with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having come to Jesus, when they saw him already having been dead, they did not break his legs;
speaker: Narrator

text: but one of the soldiers with a spear did pierce his side, and immediately there came forth blood and water;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he who hath seen hath testified, and his testimony is true, and that one hath known that true things he speaketh, that ye also may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these things came to pass, that the Writing may be fulfilled, `A bone of him shall not be broken;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and again another Writing saith, `They shall look to him whom they did pierce.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things did Joseph of Arimathea -- being a disciple of Jesus, but concealed, through the fear of the Jews -- ask of Pilate, that he may take away the body of Jesus, and Pilate gave leave; he came, therefore, and took away the body of Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Nicodemus also came -- who came unto Jesus by night at the first -- bearing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, as it were, a hundred pounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took, therefore, the body of Jesus, and bound it with linen clothes with the spices, according as it was the custom of the Jews to prepare for burial;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there was in the place where he was crucified a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one was yet laid;
speaker: Narrator

text: there, therefore, because of the preparation of the Jews, because the tomb was nigh, they laid Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the first of the sabbaths, Mary the Magdalene doth come early (there being yet darkness) to the tomb, and she seeth the stone having been taken away out of the tomb,
speaker: Narrator

text: she runneth, therefore, and cometh unto Simon Peter, and unto the other disciple whom Jesus was loving, and saith to them, `They took away the Lord out of the tomb, and we have not known where they laid him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter, therefore, went forth, and the other disciple, and they were coming to the tomb,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the two were running together, and the other disciple did run forward more quickly than Peter, and came first to the tomb,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having stooped down, seeth the linen clothes lying, yet, indeed, he entered not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter, therefore, cometh, following him, and he entered into the tomb, and beholdeth the linen clothes lying,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the napkin that was upon his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but apart, having been folded up, in one place;
speaker: Narrator

text: then, therefore, entered also the other disciple who came first unto the tomb, and he saw, and did believe;
speaker: Narrator

text: for not yet did they know the Writing, that it behoveth him out of the dead to rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples therefore went away again unto their own friends,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mary was standing near the tomb, weeping without; as she was weeping, then, she stooped down to the tomb, and beholdeth two messengers in white, sitting,
speaker: Narrator

text: one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had been laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they say to her, `Woman, why dost thou weep?' she saith to them, `Because they took away my Lord, and I have not known where they laid him;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and these things having said, she turned backward, and seeth Jesus standing, and she had not known that it is Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `Woman, why dost thou weep? whom dost thou seek;' she, supposing that he is the gardener, saith to him, `Sir, if thou didst carry him away, tell me where thou didst lay him, and I will take him away;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `Mary!' having turned, she saith to him, `Rabbouni;' that is to say, `Teacher.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to her, `Be not touching me, for I have not yet ascended unto my Father; and be going on to my brethren, and say to them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father, and to my God, and to your God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary the Magdalene cometh, telling to the disciples that she hath seen the Lord, and [that] these things he said to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: It being, therefore, evening, on that day, the first of the sabbaths, and the doors having been shut where the disciples were assembled, through fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and saith to them, `Peace to you;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and this having said, he shewed them his hands and side; the disciples, therefore, rejoiced, having seen the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, therefore, said to them again, `Peace to you; according as the Father hath sent me, I also send you;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and this having said, he breathed on [them], and saith to them, `Receive the Holy Spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: if of any ye may loose the sins, they are loosed to them; if of any ye may retain, they have been retained.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thomas, one of the twelve, who is called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came;
speaker: Narrator

text: the other disciples, therefore, said to him, `We have seen the Lord;' and he said to them, `If I may not see in his hands the mark of the nails, and may put my finger to the mark of the nails, and may put my hand to his side, I will not believe.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And after eight days, again were his disciples within, and Thomas with them; Jesus cometh, the doors having been shut, and he stood in the midst, and said, `Peace to you!'
speaker: Narrator

text: then he saith to Thomas, `Bring thy finger hither, and see my hands, and bring thy hand, and put [it] to my side, and become not unbelieving, but believing.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Thomas answered and said to him, `My Lord and my God;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to him, `Because thou hast seen me, Thomas, thou hast believed; happy those not having seen, and having believed.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Many indeed, therefore, other signs also did Jesus before his disciples, that are not written in this book;
speaker: Narrator

text: and these have been written that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing ye may have life in his name.'
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things did Jesus manifest himself again to the disciples on the sea of Tiberias, and he did manifest himself thus:
speaker: Narrator

text: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas who is called Didymus, and Nathanael from Cana of Galilee, and the [sons] of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter saith to them, `I go away to fish;' they say to him, `We go -- we also -- with thee;' they went forth and entered into the boat immediately, and on that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And morning being now come, Jesus stood at the shore, yet indeed the disciples did not know that it is Jesus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, therefore, saith to them, `Lads, have ye any meat?'
speaker: Narrator

text: they answered him, `No;' and he said to them, `Cast the net at the right side of the boat, and ye shall find;' they cast, therefore, and no longer were they able to draw it, from the multitude of the fishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: That disciple, therefore, whom Jesus was loving saith to Peter, `The Lord it is!' Simon Peter, therefore, having heard that it is the Lord, did gird on the outer coat, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the other disciples came by the little boat, for they were not far from the land, but as it were about two hundred cubits off, dragging the net of the fishes;
speaker: Narrator

text: when, therefore, they came to the land, they behold a fire of coals lying, and a fish lying on it, and bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to them, `Bring ye from the fishes that ye caught now;'
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net up on the land, full of great fishes, an hundred fifty and three, and though they were so many, the net was not rent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to them, `Come ye, dine;' and none of the disciples was venturing to inquire of him, `Who art thou?' knowing that it is the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, therefore, doth come and take the bread and give to them, and the fish in like manner;
speaker: Narrator

text: this [is] now a third time Jesus was manifested to his disciples, having been raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When, therefore, they dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, `Simon, [son] of Jonas, dost thou love me more than these?' he saith to him, `Yes, Lord; thou hast known that I dearly love thee;' he saith to him, `Feed my lambs.'
speaker: Narrator

text: He saith to him again, a second time, `Simon, [son] of Jonas, dost thou love me?' he saith to him, `Yes, Lord; thou hast known that I dearly love thee;' he saith to him, `Tend my sheep.'
speaker: Narrator

text: He saith to him the third time, `Simon, [son] of Jonas, dost thou dearly love me?' Peter was grieved that he said to him the third time, `Dost thou dearly love me?' and he said to him, `Lord, thou hast known all things; thou dost know that I dearly love thee.' Jesus saith to him, `Feed my sheep;
speaker: Narrator

text: verily, verily, I say to thee, When thou wast younger, thou wast girding thyself and wast walking whither thou didst will, but when thou mayest be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another will gird thee, and shall carry [thee] whither thou dost not will;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and this he said, signifying by what death he shall glorify God; and having said this, he saith to him, `Be following me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter having turned about doth see the disciple whom Jesus was loving following, (who also reclined in the supper on his breast, and said, `Sir, who is he who is delivering thee up?')
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter having seen this one, saith to Jesus, `Lord, and what of this one?'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus saith to him, `If him I will to remain till I come, what -- to thee? be thou following me.' This word, therefore, went forth to the brethren that that disciple doth not die,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet Jesus did not say to him, that he doth not die, but, `If him I will to remain till I come, what -- to thee?'
speaker: Narrator

text: this is the disciple who is testifying concerning these things, and he wrote these things, and we have known that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there are also many other things -- as many as Jesus did -- which, if they may be written one by one, not even the world itself I think to have place for the books written. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
